column1: Nunduinë was a river of Númenor
column2: the second longest after the Siril. It flowed westward out of the central regions of the island
column3: and as it approached the sea
column4: its waters spread to form the fragrant lake of Nísinen. Its mouth was at the haven of Eldalondë
column5: on the shores of the Bay of Eldanna.

column1: Patrick H. Wynne has suggested that Nunduinë is a Quenya name meaning "Western River"
